ARABIC: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: On the Day He says to Hell, 'Are you full?' it will ask, 'Are there no more to come?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We shall ask Hell that day: "Are you full?" It will answer: "Are there still more?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day We shall ask Hell: “Are you full?” And it will reply: “Are there any more?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On that day We shall ask hell, "Are you full?" It will say, "Are there any more?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The day when We will ask hell, “Are you filled up?” and it will answer, “Are there some more?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: On the Day when We will say to Hell: "Are you filled" It will say: "Are there any more"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: On the day that We will say to hell: Are you filled up? And it will say: Are there any more?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Upon the day We shall say unto Gehenna, 'Art thou filled?' And it shall say, 'Are there any more to come?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: On the day when We say unto hell: Art thou filled? and it saith: Can there be more to come?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: On that Day, We shall ask Hell, "Are you now full?" Hell will answer, "Are there any more?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Mention the Day whereon We shall say Unto the Hell: art thou filled? and it will say: is there yet any addition?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The day when We shall say to hell, ‘Are you full?’ It will say, ‘Is there any more?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: One Day We will ask Hell, "Art thou filled to the full?" It will say, "Are there any more (to come)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: On the Day when We will say to Hell: "Are you filled?" It will say: "Are there any more (to come)?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On that Day We shall ask Gehenna: 'Are you full' And it will answer: 'Are there any more'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: On the Day when We will say to Hell, “Are you full?” And it will say, “Are there any more?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:30] on the day (yawma is in the accusative because of zallām, ‘unjust’) when We will say (naqūlu, may also be read yaqūlu, ‘He will say’) to Hell, ‘Are you [now] full?’ (this interrogative is for confirmation of His promise to fill it [with mankind and jinn]), and it will say, by way of an interrogative, such as a question: ‘Are there any more?’: that is to say, ‘I [Hell] only have capacity for what I have been filled with’, in other words, ‘I am full!’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (On the day) this is the Day of Judgement (when We say unto hell: Art thou filled) as I have promised? (and it saith: Can there be more to come?) and it will have more; and it is also said that hell will say: I am quite full, I do not have room even for one extra man. 607
